content: Given a sentence containing at least one proper noun, use at least five adjectives in a sentence to describe it, and make sure that each adjective belongs to a different part of speech. The mountain range situated in the Pacific Northwest of the United States was strikingly majestic, undeniably awe-inspiring, eerily tranquil, incredibly vast, and unbelievably alluring.
The bustling city of New York was astonishingly vibrant, remarkably diverse, intriguingly historic, delightfully cosmopolitan, and exceptionally dynamic.
